description: From Middle English avaricious, from Old French avaricieux, from avarice, from Latin avaritia (“greed”), from avarus (“greedy”), of avere (“crave, long for”).

adjectives.description: avaricious (comparative more avaricious, superlative most avaricious)

entries.meaning: Actuated by avarice; extremely greedy for wealth or material gain; immoderately desirous of accumulating property.
examples: In a word, he was called a hard, avaricious, rapacious man, whose chief business was to enrich himself...
